name: Acceptance criteria - What is the site size.
Acceptance criteria - Is the work area clearly pegged out for line and level?
Acceptance criteria - Pavement Base and Subbase meets specification as per TfNSW Specification 3051 and construction drawings.
Acceptance criteria - Has the previous layer passed acceptance criteria?
Acceptance criteria - Fill has been placed in compacted layers as per IFC Drawing.
Acceptance criteria - Material must be maintained at optimum moisture content with additional water being added if required during compaction. Review and approve laboratory testing results
Acceptance criteria - Base / Subbase Layer has been adequately compacted achieving minimum either:
○ Review and approve laboratory testing results
Acceptance criteria - The field moisture content of base courses that are not being treated / stabilised and are to receive a bituminous seal must not exceed 70% of OMC.
Acceptance criteria - Proof rolled surfaces must not exhibit visible deformation, rutting or yielding
Acceptance criteria - Has the pavement course been finished to a smooth and uniform surface?
4.2 - Surface Level and pavement thickness of subbase / base.
Acceptance criteria - Surface Level and Pavement Thickness after compaction and surface trimming conform to the following requirements:
Acceptance criteria - Surface does not deviate more than 5mm from a 3 m straight edge when laid in any direction.
Acceptance criteria - Width of pavement between outside edges is not less than the width specified on the drawings.
Acceptance criteria - Any NCRs have been closed out
